AESC210.name: Global Systems: Economics, Engineering, Environment
AESC210.description: Globalization as a process driven by economics, enabled by engineering, and constrained by the environment. Development of systems analysis tools for understanding how these themes interact globally. Enhancement of communication skills through teaming, presentations, and active listening.
AESC210.prerequisite: (EGR 102 or CSE 231 or CSE 220) and (MTH 133 or LB 119 or MTH 153H)

AESC290.name: Independent Study in Applied Engineering Sciences
AESC290.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year
AESC290.description: Supervised individual study in an area of applied engineering sciences.
AESC290.restrictions: Open to freshmen or sophomores in the Applied Engineering Sciences Major. Approval of department.

AESC291.name: Selected Topics in Applied Engineering Sciences
AESC291.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year
AESC291.description: Topics selected to supplement and enrich existing courses and lead to the development of new courses.
AESC291.restrictions: Open to freshmen or sophomores. Approval of department.

AESC310.name: Sustainable Systems Analysis
AESC310.description: Concepts of sustainable systems applied to urban environments (smart cities). Computational analysis tools for large data sets. Case studies used to increase consensus-building skills.
AESC310.prerequisite: (AESC 210) and completion of Tier I writing requirement
AESC310.restrictions: Open to juniors or seniors in the College of Engineering and open to juniors or seniors in the Department of Marketing and open to juniors or seniors in the Department of Supply Chain Management.

AESC410.name: Capstone Project in Applied Engineering Sciences
AESC410.description: Professional work group experience with other applied engineering sciences students working on sponsor defined project. Application of applied engineering sciences curricular elements, skills and competencies.
AESC410.prerequisite: (AESC 310) and completion of Tier I writing requirement
AESC410.restrictions: Open to seniors in the Applied Engineering Sciences Major. Approval of department; application required.

AESC490.name: Independent Study in Applied Engineering Sciences
AESC490.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year
AESC490.description: Supervised individual study in an area of applied engineering sciences.
AESC490.restrictions: Open to juniors or seniors. Approval of department.

AESC491.name: Selected Topics in Applied Engineering Sciences
AESC491.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year
AESC491.description: Topics selected to supplement and enrich existing courses and lead to the development of new courses.
AESC491.restrictions: Open to juniors or seniors in the Applied Engineering Sciences Major.
